org.jtrim.property

Interface MutablePropertyProxy<ValueType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ValueType - the type of the value of the MutableProperty
    All Superinterfaces:
    MutableProperty<ValueType>, PropertySource<ValueType>

    public interface MutablePropertyProxy<ValueType>
extends MutableProperty<ValueType>
    Defines a MutableProperty which is backed by another MutableProperty. The backing MutableProperty can be replaced by a call to the replaceProperty method. The value of the MutablePropertyProxy always depends on the actual backing MutableProperty.

    The implementation takes care of properly registering listeners with the backing MutableProperty and notify listeners registered with the MutablePropertyProxy.

    Warning: Adding a listener to the MutablePropertyProxy may retain a reference to the listener even if the listener is automatically unregistered by the backing MutableProperty. Therefore you cannot rely on automatic unregistering. The only exception from this rule is when the backing MutableProperty unregisters the listeners immediately. In this latter case, implementations of MutablePropertyProxy are required to detect this and not to retain references to the listener.

    Thread safety

    The replaceProperty method of this interface are not required to be thread-safe. That is, it must not be called concurrently with other method calls of this interface unless they are defined to be thread-safe. Other methods derived from MutableProperty retain their thread-safety property.

    Recommendation: When using the property for Swing components, it is recommended to only call the replaceProperty from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread because this is consitent with other property usages in Swing.

    Synchronization transparency

    The replaceProperty method of this interface is not required to be synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    PropertyFactory.proxyProperty(MutableProperty)

      void replaceProperty(MutableProperty<ValueType> newProperty)
      Changes the backing MutableProperty to the newly specified one.

    • Method Detail

      • replaceProperty

        void replaceProperty(MutableProperty<ValueType> newProperty)
        Changes the backing MutableProperty to the newly specified one. That is, setting a value for this MutablePropertyProxy by the setValue method will set the value of the backing MutableProperty.

        Subsequent changes to the previous backing MutableProperty will not affect this MutablePropertyProxy after this method returns.

        Note: This method causes the property change listeners to be notified and in most implementation this causes the listeners to be called synchronously in this method (as with setValue).

        Parameters:
        newProperty - the new backing MutableProperty. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified MutableProperty is null
